intro: Zygophyllum marliesiae, commonly known as the Marliesa's jointvetch, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Zygophyllaceae, which includes plants adapted to harsh, dry environments. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and succulent, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water. It typically grows in rocky soils and is often found in shrublands and grasslands. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
